intro: Rosa stylosa var. congesta, commonly known as the dense-stemmed rose, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It features thorny stems and fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, red fruits called hips in the fall. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
